meanings.definition: Asserted ownership or right to something
meanings.sent1: The man's claim to the lost wallet was disputed by others.
meanings.sent2: She made a claim for the prize she believed was rightfully hers.
meanings.sent3: The cat's claim to the sunny spot by the window was challenged by the dog.
meanings.sent4: The tree's claim to the largest amount of sunlight in the garden was undeniable.
meanings.sent5: The explorer's claim to discovering the hidden treasure was met with skepticism.

meanings.definition: Stated as a fact without evidence
meanings.sent1: The self-proclaimed expert made a claimed connection between the two events.
meanings.sent2: The claimed benefits of the new product seemed too good to be true.
meanings.sent3: The claimed magical powers of the old wand were put to the test.
meanings.sent4: The claimed haunted house turned out to be just an old, creaky building.
meanings.sent5: The claimed UFO sighting was dismissed as a hoax by most people.

meanings.definition: Demanded as a right or due
meanings.sent1: The claimed compensation for the damaged goods was finally received.
meanings.sent2: The claimed refund for the faulty product was processed quickly.
meanings.sent3: The claimed extra break time was granted to the hardworking employees.
meanings.sent4: The claimed top spot in the competition was fiercely contested by all participants.
meanings.sent5: The claimed victory in the debate was celebrated with cheers and applause.
